summary: Patterns and pages designed by 19th century arch-medievalist William Morris for your mods. Updated with some larger examples i had meant to include initially. sorry for any inconvenience.
descriptionHtml:
William Morris (1834-1896) was an author, artist, designer and medievalist often credited with writing the first high fantasy books.

These are images i've had sitting around waiting for me to do something with them on my desktop for a while.
They're a mix of seamless patterns and slices big enough to be made seamless, some random pages from his books and a rare painting of his, all in medieval or pseudo-medieval styles, useful for wallpapers or fabric patterns.

Loads more of his patterns and images are widely available. I'm mostly posting this because I like his work and I think others would too.

Cheers!

Red

edit; Updated with some larger examples I had meant to include initially. Sorry for any inconvenience.
author: William Morris collected by Murderclan
